about.name: Porto
about.info_text: Porto, often called Oporto, is a picturesque city in Portugal known for its historic charm, rich cultural heritage, and world-famous port wine. Located along the Douro River, Porto is famous for its colorful buildings, medieval old town, and stunning bridges. Visitors can explore the Ribeira district, visit wine cellars, and enjoy the vibrant cafe culture. Porto offers a unique blend of old-world character and modern vitality, making it a captivating destination for travelers.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.7 million (Greater Porto Area)
Region: Norte Region
Time Zone: Western European Time (UTC+00:00)
Language: Portuguese
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Porto experiences a Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and warm, dry summers. It is known for its pleasant weather and sunny days, making it an ideal destination year-round.

attractions_card.title: Ribeira District
attractions_card.description: The Ribeira district is Porto's historic heart, with narrow streets, colorful buildings, and waterfront cafes overlooking the Douro River.

attractions_card.title: Livaria Lello
attractions_card.description: Livaria Lello is a stunning bookshop with intricate architecture and is said to have inspired the Harry Potter series.

attractions_card.title: Douro River Cruises
attractions_card.description: Douro River cruises offer a scenic way to explore the Douro Valley's vineyards, charming villages, and terraced hills.

attractions_card.title: Clérigos Tower
attractions_card.description: The Clérigos Tower is an iconic landmark in Porto, offering panoramic views of the city from its bell tower.

attractions_card.title: Serralves Foundation
attractions_card.description: Serralves Foundation is a cultural institution with contemporary art exhibitions, beautiful gardens, and a pink art deco villa.

attractions_card.title: Palácio da Bolsa
attractions_card.description: Palácio da Bolsa is a neoclassical building with ornate rooms, including the stunning Arabian Hall.

attractions_card.title: Clerics Church
attractions_card.description: Clerics Church is a baroque masterpiece known for its exquisite interior and ornate woodwork.

attractions_card.title: Port Wine Cellars
attractions_card.description: Porto is famous for its port wine; visit the cellars in Vila Nova de Gaia to learn about the wine-making process and enjoy tastings.

food_card.title: Francesinha
food_card.description: Francesinha is a hearty Portuguese sandwich made with layers of cured meats, covered in cheese, and smothered in a spicy sauce.

food_card.title: Bacalhau à Gomes de Sá
food_card.description: Bacalhau à Gomes de Sá is a classic Portuguese codfish dish, featuring salted cod with potatoes, onions, and eggs.

food_card.title: Pastéis de Nata
food_card.description: Pastéis de Nata are traditional Portuguese custard tarts with flaky pastry, enjoyed with coffee or as a dessert.

food_card.title: Francesinha
food_card.description: Francesinha is a hearty Portuguese sandwich made with layers of cured meats, covered in cheese, and smothered in a spicy sauce.

hotels_card.title: The Yeatman
hotels_card.description: The Yeatman is a luxurious wine-themed hotel in Vila Nova de Gaia, offering stunning views of Porto, wine cellars, and a Michelin-starred restaurant.

hotels_card.title: Pestana Palácio do Freixo
hotels_card.description: Pestana Palácio do Freixo is a historic palace hotel with riverside views and a beautiful baroque architecture.

hotels_card.title: InterContinental Porto - Palácio das Cardosas
hotels_card.description: InterContinental Porto - Palácio das Cardosas is a luxury hotel located in the heart of Porto, offering elegant rooms and a historic setting.

hotels_card.title: Torel Avantgarde
hotels_card.description: Torel Avantgarde is a boutique hotel with unique design, stunning city views, and a tranquil atmosphere.

transport_card.title: Francisco Sá Carneiro Airport
transport_card.description: Francisco Sá Carneiro Airport is the main international airport serving Porto, offering various transportation options to the city center.

transport_card.title: Trams and Buses
transport_card.description: Porto's tram and bus network provides convenient public transportation, connecting different parts of the city, including historic tram lines.

transport_card.title: Porto Metro
transport_card.description: Porto Metro is a modern and efficient way to navigate the city, serving various neighborhoods and attractions.

transport_card.title: Dom Luís I Bridge
transport_card.description: The iconic Dom Luís I Bridge is both a pedestrian bridge and a double-deck iron bridge that spans the Douro River, connecting Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia.

transport_card.title: Taxis in Porto
transport_card.description: Taxis in Porto are readily available and offer a convenient way to travel around the city, especially for reaching specific destinations.

transport_card.title: Ferries on the Douro River
transport_card.description: Ferries on the Douro River provide a scenic means of exploring both Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia, offering beautiful river views.
